pull.title: Add P2P, Network, and Qt categories to the desktop icon

events.message: Add P2P, Network, and Qt categories to the desktop icon

events.body: Is Debian the only distro supporting this standard?

freedesktop standards in principle apply to all distributions and window managers.
So it would make sense to move it from `contrib/debian` to a place where `make install` can install it (not in thie PR though).

comments.body:
I don 't think `Qt` is a useful category. It's like adding `C++`. Not relevant to classifying the application.
Agree with adding `P2P` or `Network` though I'd say one of them is enough (but adding both is fine with me...).

The `Qt` category is defined as "Application based on Qt libraries", which certainly applies to bitcoin-qt.

https://specifications.freedesktop.org/menu-spec/latest/apas02.html

Huh, okay.
Well if it's part of the standard then ok...
